answer_html: \(c_n=\begin{cases} \frac{1}{2} & \text{if } n=0 \\ 0 & \text{if } n \text{ is even, } n \not= 0\\ \frac{-i}{\pi n} & \text{if } n \text{ is odd} \end{cases}\)
question: Section 202 06 (a)
sols_html:
Since \(e^{i2\pi nx}\) is an orthonormal basis for any function in the Hilbert Space we can use the inner product to find the coefficients:

\[\begin{aligned} \left \langle e^{i2\pi mx},f(x) \right \rangle =\sum_{n=-\infty}^{\infty}c_n \left \langle e^{i2\pi mx},e^{i2\pi nx} \right \rangle=c_mL\end{aligned}\]

Therefore we get:

\[\begin{aligned} c_n=\frac{1}{L}\int_{a}^{b}e^{-2\pi inx/L}f(x)dx\end{aligned}\]

Computing this for the given function

\[\begin{aligned} c_0 &= \frac{1}{1}[\int_{0}^{1/2}e^{-i2\pi (0)x}dx+\int_{1/2}^{1}e^{-i2\pi (0)x}(0)dx] = \frac{1}{2} \\ c_n &= \frac{1}{1}[\int_{0}^{1/2}e^{-i2\pi nx}dx+\int_{1/2}^{1}e^{-i2\pi nx}(0)dx] \\ &=\frac{-1}{i2\pi n}e^{-i2\pi nx} \Big|_0^{1/2} =\frac{-1}{i2\pi n}[e^{-i\pi n}-e^0] \\ &=\frac{i}{2\pi n}[(-1)^n-1]\end{aligned}\]

\(c_n=\begin{cases} \frac{1}{2} & \text{if } n=0 \\ 0 & \text{if } n \text{ is even, } n \not= 0\\ \frac{-i}{\pi n} & \text{if } n \text{ is odd} \end{cases}\)

statement_html:
Find the coefficients cn in the Fourier series \(f(x) = \sum_{n = -\infty}^\infty c_n e^{2\pi inx}\) if

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) = \begin{cases} 1, & 0 \leq x < 1/2 \\ 0, & 1/2 \leq x \leq 1 \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]
